author: ZZT

review: I got my Chromecast a few days ago and have been using it a lot. I love that I can control the content easily with my phone, and don't need a separate remote like a Roku.I want to give this 5 stars, I really do, but there are a few things missing, some of which are at least rumored to be in the works. I'm waiting for a full integration with Plex (should be coming the next next couple of months), and an SDK to allow streaming any content. I wish the cast extension was supported on linux, but hopefully that will come in time. Other than that, my only concern is that it doesn't allow any sort of security. This is probably by design, but I usually wouldn't want everyone on my wifi network to be able to control my Chromecast. Fortunately, it lets you know if somebody else is casting to a device, so it's hard to accidentally override somebody else.In short, if you don't use Linux, aren't a developer, and don't plan to use Plex on it (for the next month or two), treat my review as a definite buy!

review: I was really excited when I ordered this.  It turns out that the only thing I can stream to it are purchased music through Google Music app.  You cant stream images or home videos from your device.  Once I cancelled my Google All Access music subscription then I wasnt able to stream anything at all.  It gave an error saying it cant stream side-loaded music, only music purchased through them.  So now it just sits behind the TV never to be used again.  I guess it can stream Youtube and Netflix but the quality wasnt very good for me. The best way I found to get any media from your phone to the TV is to get a Roku and an app called Allcast.
